pull.title: De-neuter NODE_BLOOM
pull.body: Disconnect nodes which request bloom filtering in violation of the protocol.

issue.title: De-neuter NODE_BLOOM
issue.body: I forget things easily, so I'm gonna get a few months ahead of myself and PR this now...to be merged a full release cycle after #6579.

events.body: Has someone checked what impact this would have now? (Wouldn't preclude a merge in master, since there is still a fair amount of time to respond before release-- but it would be good to know).

@gmaxwell Very little, I expect. the intersection of nodes that::
- Will immediately upgrade to code that includes this
- Set `-peerbloomfilters` false (it defaults to true, and will continue to do so)
- Are not yet using `-enforcenodebloom` on 0.12

Is likely to be very, very small.

This is just continuing the planning, in 0.12 NODE_BLOOM was introduced but not yet enforced (by default) for old versions, and the plan is that in 0.13 it will be enforced for all versions. 

What kind of measurement do you think should change that planning?

In no case this is going to be backported to 0.12.
Added a counter to my SPV stats node to see how many SPV nodes have not adapted the new rule.
Ah. Indeed, I was forgetting that with peerbloomfilters defaulting to true this would have no effect. Still, interesting to know if there has been any progress or not.

events.message: Always disconnect old nodes which request filtered connections.

events.body: @pstratem What is the impact of not disconnecting these nodes?

And not disconnecting them when they request a bloom filter which we don't
provide would make them unnecessarily stall. By disconnecting you give them
an opportunity to find a better peer.

issue.title: Bitcoin Core should throw a warning if peerbloomfilters=1
issue.body:
In line with conversation about the risks of BIP37 peer bloom filters (#6579, #7708), Bitcoin Core should throw a warning during init if the `peerbloomfilters` boolean is enabled (this is currently set by default). Running `NODE_BLOOM` enabled presents severe risks to node operators (#9238) which they may be unaware of. 

In public knowledge the p2p protocol extension has been used for large scale anti attacks using the `mempool` command to bypass transaction trickling, denial of service due to the enormous CPU load caused by the act of filtering blocks, and potentially other undisclosed issues. This is a stepping stone towards eventually default disabling the feature.

issue.title: [Port] Always disconnect old nodes which request filtered connections.
issue.body:
See bitcoin#7708:

Disconnect nodes which request bloom filtering in violation of the protocol.

issue.title: DGB p2p connection disconnects every 60 seconds, no block updates received
issue.body:
A disconnect happens between NOMP and the digibyted p2p port after exactly 60 seconds. No block updates are ever received via this method from digibyted. RPC polls and blockupdate methods both work fine. The peermagic supplied in the coin configs is correct. Connections are successfully made, and a peer shows up as connected using the digibyted api, but then a disconnect happens after 60 seconds every time. NOMP reconnects, and then another disconnect after 60 seconds. Repeat.

Could something cause this on the digibyted side? 
some logs:


--- nomp ----
2018-08-04 18:52:23 [Pool]      [digibyte-qubit] (Thread 2) p2p connection successful
2018-08-04 18:52:50 [Pool]      [digibyte-qubit] (Thread 1) Block notification via RPC polling
2018-08-04 18:52:50 [Pool]      [digibyte-qubit] (Thread 2) Block notification via RPC polling

2018-08-04 18:53:06 [Pool]      [digibyte-qubit] (Thread 2) Block notification via RPC polling
2018-08-04 18:53:06 [Pool]      [digibyte-qubit] (Thread 1) Block notification via RPC polling
2018-08-04 18:53:20 [Pool]      [digibyte-qubit] (Thread 2) Block notification via RPC polling
2018-08-04 18:53:20 [Pool]      [digibyte-qubit] (Thread 1) Block notification via RPC polling
2018-08-04 18:53:24 [Pool]      [digibyte-qubit] (Thread 2) p2p peer node disconnected - attempting reconnection...
2018-08-04 18:53:24 [Pool]      [digibyte-qubit] (Thread 1) p2p peer node disconnected - attempting reconnection...
2018-08-04 18:53:24 [Pool]      [digibyte-qubit] (Thread 2) p2p connection successful
2018-08-04 18:53:24 [Pool]      [digibyte-qubit] (Thread 1) p2p connection successful
